version_name: includes a quick glance view and an app that shows your upcoming events for today and tomorrow
includes a quick glance view and an app that shows your upcoming events for today and tomorrow

version_description: General improvements
General improvements
Stability and performance enhancements
Stability and performance enhancements

We have improved the layout of the Calendar Presets tab in this version. It is prominent now and you can even add pictures to your presets to help remember them! We have great things planned for Presets, so stay tuned! Additionally, this update further improves emoji handling for your events and calendars.

We have improved the layout of the Calendar Presets tab in this version. It is prominent now and you can even add pictures to your presets to help remember them! We have great things planned for Presets, so stay tuned! Additionally, this update further improves emoji handling for your events and calendars.

- optimizes storage of preset pictures
- fixes a bug where preset order would not be remembered after reordering
- fixes bugs with using the Tools menu in landscape orientation
- uses the calendar time zone for the current time indicator in week view

Please keep sending your feedback so that we continue making Week Calendar the best calendar app for you! More wonderful things and features are coming, so stay tuned!

- optimizes storage of preset pictures
- fixes a bug where preset order would not be remembered after reordering
- fixes bugs with using the Tools menu in landscape orientation
- uses the calendar time zone for the current time indicator in week view

Please keep sending your feedback so that we continue making Week Calendar the best calendar app for you! More wonderful things and features are coming, so stay tuned!

iOS 11 is out and so is an update to your favorite calendar application! We have been busy testing Week Calendar on the latest iOS and making sure that it stays reliable and fast.

That's not it. With this version, we are introducing a brand new iMessage app! The app can be used to share your upcoming and recently viewed events with individuals and groups without leaving iMessage. They don't even have to be a Week Calendar user to be able to receive shared events (although it is better if they are users!).

Also in this version:

• fixes an issue that prevented some very rare kind of events from being deleted
• fixes an issue with the custom Move event tool that caused it to be misaligned
• improves location handling while editing and viewing events
• adds major improvements to the event details view - map is bigger, tappable, and has better UI.
• fixes a rare crash while viewing events in agenda view
• fixes an issue where the map in event details might sometimes point to a different location
• various other improvements

We have many more improvements planned for upcoming versions, along with a ton of new features. Stay posted!

As always, we love receiving feedback about how we are doing and what we could do to continue developing Week Calendar as the only calendar application that you need. Thanks for your support!

Finally, the update you've been waiting for! 11.1 brings support for iPhone X to Week Calendar. And not only that, while we were improving layout for the new iPhones, we decided to give the app some very nice performance and stability upgrades. As a result, the app should be noticeably faster, especially when viewing and editing events. We also have a bunch of improvements planned for location handling, so stay tuned.

In addition, this update:

• fixes an issue where picking a location through autocomplete/map would sometimes duplicate the address in the location field
• fixes an issue where tapping on a phone number embedded in the location field would not call it
• fixes an issue where the notes field would 'flicker' while editing it
• fixes issues with address formatting while editing events
• fixes an issue where zooming into a day in week view while weekends were hidden would open another day
• drastically reduces app footprint
• adds various other performance and stability improvements

As always, we love receiving feedback about how we are doing and what we could do to continue developing Week Calendar as the only calendar application you need. Thanks for your support!

version_name: 12.0 added support for Siri Shortcuts! Want a quick way to open your upcoming event? Just use the shortcut! In addition to the default shortcuts that you could discover in the Shortcuts app or in iOS settings

version_description:
The last update caused some crashes upon launch for users on iOS 10. We have fixed them in this version.

As always, we love receiving feedback about how we are doing and what we could do to continue developing Week Calendar as the only calendar application you need. Thanks for your support!

version_name: 12.0 added support for Siri Shortcuts! Want a quick way to open your upcoming event? Just use the shortcut! In addition to the default shortcuts that you could discover in the Shortcuts app or in iOS settings

version_description:
The last update caused some crashes upon launch for users on iOS 10. We have fixed them in this version.

As always, we love receiving feedback about how we are doing and what we could do to continue developing Week Calendar as the only calendar application you need. Thanks for your support!

We know you love sharing your events with friends and family, and so we have made it really simple to do just that! The event details popup now includes a quick action bar to easily share your events using any app you like or in Messages or by email. Do give it a try!

We didn't stop there! This version also introduces a brand new search feature for exciting calendar content right from our calendar store. Wish to stay updated with your favorite sports team's schedule or upcoming concerts? Just subscribe to their own calendars.

In addition, this version also includes our regular maintenance updates and fixes to enable even better future updates and new features. As always, we love receiving feedback about how we are doing. Rate us or contact us directly from within the app. Thanks for your support!

This is a minor bug fix release to address new and existing issues. It fixes a bug that resulted in iCloud calendar events sometimes showing up with the location repeated. It also improves language selection and fixes a bug where some languages were not accurately reflected in the picker.

Lastly, there are a few under-the-hood improvements that improve stability and performance, and enable even better future updates. As always, we love receiving feedback about how we are doing. Rate us on the App Store or contact us directly from within the app. Thanks for your support!

This version introduces an all-new premium subscription that unlocks all features as well as unlimited calendar subscriptions for exciting and informative updates on sports, weather, concerts, and holidays!

Also includes some other bug fixes and performance updates. As always, please rate the app if you like using it.

This version adds support for Siri Shortcuts! Want a quick way to open your upcoming event? Just use the shortcut! In addition to the default shortcuts that you could discover in the Shortcuts app or in iOS settings, we have added a few more that would surface as you use Week Calendar frequently, based on the amazing machine learning capabilities of Siri! Do give them a try and let us know what you think about them or how we could make the Siri capabilities even more powerful and useful.

In addition, this release adds support for your new iPhone Xs Max. View your calendar on the wonderful big screen!

Also includes some other bug fixes and performance updates. As always, please rate the app if you like using it.

Try before you buy! We are going to make it easy for you to experience all the benefits of a Pro subscription without paying for it! Well, at least for the first 14 days. Unlimited Smart Calendar subscriptions, fresh updates and enhancements, and a fully unlocked premium experience, now available to try out for free.

This version also improves adding of event locations when using the map search view. It's so good now that you might as well just use it all the time to create events. Tap on the 'placemark' icon in the location field to try it out.

Also includes some other bug fixes and performance updates. As always, please rate the app if you like using it.

Version 12.0 added support for Siri Shortcuts! Want a quick way to open your upcoming event? Just use the shortcut! In addition to the default shortcuts that you could discover in the Shortcuts app or in iOS settings, we added a few more that would surface as you use Week Calendar frequently, based on the amazing machine learning capabilities of Siri!

Introducing Reminders! You asked for it, and here it is! Now you can easily use WeekCal to create reminders for everything from picking up your groceries to calling your loved ones on their birthday. You can even create location based alerts to remind yourself at the perfect moment. And the best part -- reminders are part of your calendar. They look just like regular events. You can enable or hide different reminder lists on your phone, and they play really well with your exiting presets. In fact, you can even create new reminder presets!

In summary, this version:

• adds support for creating, editing, and visualizing your important reminders
• reminders appear as events on your calendar views
• includes capability to hide specific reminder lists, just like your calendars
• adds a brand new, and still being improved, view to visualize all your reminders in a list
• plenty of other stability and performance improvements

As always, please do rate us on the AppStore if you like the app, and contact us for feedback on how we are doing or to send us ideas and stories!

This version introduces some stability improvements.
This version introduces some stability improvements.

This update includes UI bug fixes, general optimizations, and improved crash reporting for better user experience going forward.

In detail, this includes:

• Minor UI bug fixes for Day, Agenda, Mini Month, and Year calendar views
• Improved crash reporting
• Updated App Store screenshots
• Bug fixes, optimizations, and stability improvements
• We have concluded the in-app survey, thanks to everyone who participated! We are reviewing your feedback and will incorporate your suggestions into future updates.

Have feedback or suggestions for us? Drop us a line via the help section of the app and we’ll quickly reply back to help out.

Special thanks to our WeekCal Pro subscribers for your support, and stay tuned for our next update!

- The WeekCal Team

We now have iOS 13 optimizations in this update. In addition, you can change your WeekCal app icon to your favorite color!

Here's everything that's included in this release:
• iOS 13 optimizations
• Customize your app icon by choosing between 10 different colors.
• Change your app icon anytime in Settings -> Layout -> App Icon Color
• General bug fixes & app improvements
• Updated first time user experience for new WeekCal users

Have feedback or suggestions for us? Drop us a line via the help section of the app and we’ll quickly reply back to help out.

Special thanks to our WeekCal Pro subscribers for your support, and stay tuned for our next update!

- The WeekCal Team

A new WeekCal update has arrived!

Special thanks to all of our users, especially our WeekCal Pro users - thanks for supporting the app & making WeekCal possible!

Here's what you'll find in this release:

● Dark Mode has arrived to WeekCal. To enable, go to Settings -> Layouts and enable the Auto color scheme. WeekCal will now honor your device Dark Mode settings, or you can manually enable dark mode via Control Center.

● Apple Watch Series 4 and 5 watch face complications are now supported
Improved Search filtering, start & end functionality and navigation improved for iOS 13. Search performance also improved in the Calendar Store.

● Updated Calendar Store support updated for Football (Soccer) and Basketball

● Backup settings via email is now supported on iOS 13, for easier transfer of settings between devices (Settings -> General -> Synchronize Settings -> Backup Settings via Email, make sure to tap "more" to see all options)

● UI improvements & updates have been made throughout the app

● Top fixes & improvements: Resolved calendar sharing via web issue, resolved navigation issue that would set date to 1900, Emoji keyboard now launches automatically when adding Emoji to an event

● Many more small but significant updates & improvements

Questions? Feedback? Let us know, we're here to support you.
Email us at support@weekcal.com or just tap "Provide Feedback" in the help section of the app for fast and friendly assistance from our team.

A new WeekCal update has arrived!

Special thanks to all of our users, especially our WeekCal Pro users - thanks for supporting the app & making WeekCal possible!

Here's what you'll find in this release:

● Dark Mode has arrived to WeekCal. To enable, go to Settings -> Layouts and enable the Auto color scheme. WeekCal will now honor your device Dark Mode settings, or you can manually enable dark mode via Control Center.

● Apple Watch Series 4 and 5 watch face complications are now supported
Improved Search filtering, start & end functionality and navigation improved for iOS 13. Search performance also improved in the Calendar Store.

● Updated Calendar Store support updated for Football (Soccer) and Basketball

● Backup settings via email is now supported on iOS 13, for easier transfer of settings between devices (Settings -> General -> Synchronize Settings -> Backup Settings via Email, make sure to tap "more" to see all options)

● UI improvements & updates have been made throughout the app

● Top fixes & improvements: Resolved calendar sharing via web issue, resolved navigation issue that would set date to 1900, Emoji keyboard now launches automatically when adding Emoji to an event

● Many more small but significant updates & improvements

Questions? Feedback? Let us know, we're here to support you.
Email us at support@weekcal.com or just tap "Provide Feedback" in the help section of the app for fast and friendly assistance from our team.

A new WeekCal update has arrived!

Special thanks to all of our users, especially our WeekCal Pro subscribers - thanks for supporting the app & making WeekCal possible!

● This update includes a number of small but significant improvements, based on your feedback, to our last release. This includes improvements for iOS 12 users (white text, copy / paste, event deletion button missing) and for all users for Dark Mode (text color on custom event colors is now optimized).

● If you'd like to disable Dark Mode, disable it in iOS settings, or in WeekCal go to Settings -> Layout -> Color Scheme -> Try the Contrasting or Glossy options for a lighter look.

Full release notes from our latest release:

● Dark Mode has arrived in WeekCal. To enable, go to Settings -> Layouts and enable the Auto color scheme. WeekCal will now honor your device Dark Mode settings, or you can manually enable Dark Mode via Control Center.

● Apple Watch Series 4 and 5 watch face complications are now supported
Improved Search filtering, start & end functionality and navigation improved for iOS 13. Search performance also improved in the Calendar Store.

● Updated Calendar Store support updated for Football (Soccer) and Basketball

● Backup settings via email is now supported on iOS 13, for easier transfer of settings between devices (Settings -> General -> Synchronize Settings -> Backup Settings via Email, make sure to tap "more" to see all options)

● UI improvements & updates have been made throughout the app

● Top fixes & improvements: Resolved calendar sharing via web issue, resolved navigation issue that would set date to 1900, Emoji keyboard now launches automatically when adding Emoji to an event

● Many more small but significant updates & improvements across the app

Email us at support@weekcal.com or just tap "Provide Feedback" in the help section of the app for fast and friendly assistance from our team.

Special thanks to all of our users, especially our WeekCal Pro subscribers - thanks for supporting the app & making WeekCal possible!

- By popular demand, iPad support has arrived in WeekCal. You can now use WeekCal on iPad and iPad Pro devices. Stay tuned for more advanced features and UI / UX improvements for iPad in future updates.
- Split View is also now supported for iPad and iPad Pro, now you can multitask with another app at the same time. To enable, open the app -> swipe up from the bottom of the screen to open the Dock. On the Dock, touch and hold the second app that you want to open, then drag it off the dock to the left or right edge of the screen.
- Having issues on iOS 14? Make sure calendar permissions are enabled in Device Settings -> WeekCal -> Calendars and make sure the Calendar is toggled On. iOS 14 caused some users calendar to disappear and this will resolve it.
- Many other small but significant performance updates & stability improvements across the app and Calendar Store.

Questions? Feedback? Let us know, we’re here to support you.
Email us at support@weekcal.com or just tap “Provide Feedback” in the help section of the app for fast and friendly assistance from our team.

A new WeekCal update has arrived & we are very excited to introduce home screen widgets for iOS 14 users on iPhone and iPad! Special thanks to all of our users, especially our WeekCal Pro subscribers - thank you for supporting the app & making WeekCal possible!

- My Schedule Widget: This home screen widget displays upcoming events for the day and is available in a small size widget (free for all users) and medium size widget (exclusive to Pro subscribers).
- Today’s Date Widget: This home screen widget displays the month, day and date and is available as a small widget for all users.
- To add widgets to your Home Screen: Tap and hold on an empty area of the Home Screen and enter the Edit Home Screen mode (jiggle mode) > Tap the + button at the top corner > Explore the WeekCal widgets in the Widget Gallery and add them to your Home Screen for easy access. You can also add WeekCal widgets to a widget Smart Stack.
- For more information on the WeekCal widgets, open Weekcal, then head to Settings > iOS 14 Widgets and learn how to best use them.
- Minor improvements and app optimizations, based on your feedback

Questions? Feedback? Let us know, we’re here to support you.
Email us at support@weekcal.com or just tap “Provide Feedback” in the help section of the app for fast and friendly assistance from our team.

A new WeekCal update has arrived & we are very excited to introduce home screen widgets and video conferencing features for iOS 14 users on iPhone and iPad! Special thanks to all of our users, especially our WeekCal Pro subscribers - thank you for supporting the app & making WeekCal possible!

● My Schedule Widget: This home screen widget displays upcoming events for the day and is available in a small size widget (free for all users) and a medium size widget with more advanced features like the Join Meeting button for quick access to upcoming video calls (exclusive to Pro subscribers).
● Today’s Date Widget: This home screen widget displays the month, day and date and is available as a small widget for all users.
● NEW Join Meeting Button: Quickly jump into conference calls with a single tap from any calendar event (Zoom, Google Meet + other meeting services)
● To add Widgets to your home screen: Tap and hold on an empty area of the home screen and enter the edit home screen mode (jiggle mode) > Tap the + button at the top corner > Explore the WeekCal widgets in the Widget gallery and add them to your home screen for easy access. You can also add WeekCal widgets to a widget Smart Stack.
● For more information on the WeekCal widgets, open Weekcal, then head to Settings > iOS 14 Widgets and learn how to best use them.
● We also squashed a bug related to Automation settings that affected some users in our last update; thanks to everyone who reported this issue.

Questions? Feedback? Let us know, we’re here to support you.
Email us at support@weekcal.com or just tap “Provide Feedback” in the help section of the app for fast and friendly assistance from our team.
